alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 15 at 6:03AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL 40 TO 55 BELOW INTO THURSDAY... Cold temperatures will continue in the Kotzebue Sound Region with low temperatures dipping into the 20s to 30s below, while high temperatures will struggle into the teens and 20s below. These temperatures coupled with winds generally less than 10 mph into Thursday, except for the area from the Red Dog Dock north along the coast where winds will pick up to 15 to 25 mph on Wednesday, will cause wind chill values to dip into the 40 to 55 below range through Wednesday into Thursday. Residents should use caution if they are outside and ensure that they are protected from the cold as frostbite can occur with less than 10 minutes of exposure. For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.
